definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Not-suing is an important instition of our country's criminal suit law.
sentences.chinese: 不起诉是我国刑事诉讼法的一项重要制度。

sentences.english: Criminal laws stipulate that detention de bene esse can apply to active criminal.
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼法规定对现行犯可以适用先行拘留。

sentences.english: The status and function for the spy proceeding in the criminal law have been discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第一章论述了侦查程序在刑事诉讼法中的地位与功能。

sentences.english: Thus, this author urges that we should abrogate this principle while amending the Criminal Procedural Act.
sentences.chinese: 因此，应当在修改《刑事诉讼法》时废除这一制度。

sentences.english: China's Criminal Procedural Law does not provide for the preliminary investigation system.
sentences.chinese: 我国《刑事诉讼法》中并未规定初查制度。

sentences.english: However, little research has been conducted on the right of private prosecution in criminal litigation.
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼法学界对刑事自诉权理论的研究尚不够充分。

sentences.english: Our country's law of criminal procedure lacks the regulations to the system.
sentences.chinese: 我国刑事诉讼法对刑事缺席审判制度缺乏明文规定。

definition: criminal procedure/abbr. for 刑事訴訟法|刑事诉讼法
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
period during which one can prosecute or sue sb/within the statute of limitation
to assess punishment/to determine the sentence (on a criminal)
